channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-3970] Certain OneNote documents produce duplicate text
item.description:
Extracting text from certain OneNote documents produces more text than is actually in the document.     In this case, the OneNote document was created by opening a Word document and "printing" it to the OneNote.    

To reproduce the issue, open the attached "lyrics.one" using the Tika App version 2.7.0 and view the plain text.     Look for the phrase "Sunday Morning" and observe that there are 14 occurrences.    However in the actual displayed text, it occurs only once.     

The original text in this document is only about 12K characters, but the extracted text from tika is over 300K.
item.summary: Certain OneNote documents produce duplicate text

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: I forgot to mention that the extracted text also seems to contain lots of cryptic-looking "hidden" text.     This text seems to be formatting information.    I was only able to see this text while doing java debugging on my application code.     The TikaApp does not display this formatting text.
Further analysis has revealed that the "duplicate text" is actually the version history of the document's contents.

Thank you for digging into this. That was my guess. I haven't had much time to look. After I installed OneNote, I was enraged to find that I couldn't open a local file on my laptop. I had to put it in a OneDrive account, which I haven't gotten around to doing. LOL...

Are you aware of any non-Microsoft viewers?
Sadly, I am not aware of any free, non-Microsoft viewers.    But I have not spent much time searching.
When I set crawlAllFileNodesFromRoot to false, I get the attached. It is slightly better. Out of order and still with two copies?
Actually, the pages are in reversed order and the "start turning the wool across the wire...I'm coming home today" is the only page that is repeated?

The reason the first page is repeated is that it is included in both the ElementChildNodesOfVersionHistory – a list of the child elements for a section – AND in the StructureElementChildNodes – which is a reference to the title node of a page.

The current code literally walks the tree and processes every element. To fix this, we'd need to add a bit more processing to avoid extracting text from the StructureElementChildNodes if the single element in there is already processed (or is going to be processed).

This does not fix the reversed order of the pages, but this does get us closer.
cc ndipiazza if you want to jump back in! I completely realize that there is no warranty on contributions!

Finally logged into OneNote, and it isn't reading anything in the file...

Didier Stevens' onedump.py at least reports some embedded files:

1: 0x000183e8 .PNG 89504e47 0x0002215c 4525bb925975a4f06f112e7227b46d6a

nddipiazza opened a new pull request, #975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/975

  • start correctly handling the onlyLatestRevision option by detecting parent property id of type ElementChildNodesOfVersionHistory and do not print those if that flag is set.
  • need to prevent File Node references to the same text from being printed out in the xml stream multiple times.
  • improve PropertyValue to have a toString so that debugging in IDE is easier.
    @[nddipiazza](https://github.com/apache/tika/commits?author=nddipiazza)
    nddipiazza committed 1 minute ago

nddipiazza commented on PR #975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/975#issuecomment-1439425951

@tballison please review for fix of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/TIKA-3970

tballison merged PR #975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/975

tballison commented on PR #975:
URL: https://github.com/apache/tika/pull/975#issuecomment-1441866279

@nddipiazza Many thanks!

Thank you, ndipiazza! Seriously, there is no warranty!

Should we reverse the iteration order of the pages? I notice that we're getting page2 then page1 in one of our existing tests. So this might be a feature or something we're missing in our implementation? I couldn't find anything in the spec about this.

Related: I noticed a "page number" property for each of the page nodes in the attached file. Maybe we could use that info to order the pages when it exists?

This would require some walking the tree and caching page order. I'm happy to give it a try.

Side note: I'm still really frustrated that I can't open a bunch of these files in OneNote even after I set up my Microsoft account and save the files in OneDrive.

Wait, what?!

https://www.michaelkc.dk/2020/02/26/ordering-pages-inside-sections-in-onenote.html

fix TIKA-3970 (#975) (github: https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/dd72f6b68ae14e3cf85543807d6fb9c14777ddcd)

> Should we reverse the iteration order of the pages? I notice that we're getting page2 then page1 in one of our existing tests. So this might be a feature or something we're missing in our implementation? I couldn't find anything in the spec about this. Related: I noticed a "page number" property for each of the page nodes in the attached file. Maybe we could use that info to order the pages when it exists?

Yeah sure! That sounds like a really good idea.

> This would require some walking the tree and caching page order. I'm happy to give it a try.

Yeah! that's what I spent a few hours doing with this PR above. I need to spend some more time on it probably i just kinda got the Jira's test case to work.

> Side note: I'm still really frustrated that I can't open a bunch of these files in OneNote even after I set up my Microsoft account and save the files in OneDrive.

Yeah so there are two types of OneNote files, the MS-ONESTORE spec, and the ones that use the alternative packaging MS-FSSHTTPD.

If you open a file from onenote office 365, it will use the alternative packaging. 

If you open a file from onenote from local microsoft office 365, it will use the ms-onestore spec.

So I think you might need to grab a copy of MS office: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/use-the-office-offline-installer-f0a85fe7-118f-41cb-a791-d59cef96ad1c you could then work with this.

So on Windows PC I log into 

https://account.microsoft.com/services/microsoft365/details#install

Then click where it says Install Office

Eventually you should have a copy of office installed on your machine. Then you should be able to open all the files:

 

tika-parsers/tika-parsers-standard/tika-parsers-standard-modules/tika-parser-microsoft-module/src/test/resources/test-documents/testOneNote.one

Thank you, Nick!
Hi all, has this issue been resolved? 2.8.0 and later still have duplicate content issues, as mentioned in TIKA-4303
Rather the file in TIKA-4303 is missing the chinese text that was there before the commit of 2023. This happens only in 2.9.2 but not in 3.0 despite that both commits are identical.
